findings: Workflow logic needs refactoring to improve clarity and maintainability.
Magic numbers should be extracted to constants for better readability and to avoid hardcoding values.
Missing documentation for complex logic makes it difficult for future developers to understand the intent and functionality.
The diff introduces new workflow logic without any unit tests, which is critical for ensuring the correctness of the implementation.

Test Suggestion 1: Create unit tests for the new workflow logic to cover various scenarios, including normal operation and edge cases, to ensure that the workflow behaves as expected under different conditions.
Test Suggestion 2: Implement tests for error handling within the workflow, specifically testing how the system responds to invalid inputs or unexpected states, to ensure robustness.

Test Suggestion 3: Add integration tests that validate the interaction between the new workflow and existing components, ensuring that data flows correctly and that the overall system functions as intended.

prTitle: [WIP] Address feedback on Java Temporal workflow
author: Copilot
